item.title: Optimize Firefox’s sqlite databases
item.description: Here’s a handy one-liner to tune a bit your Firefox: for file in ~/.mozilla/firefox/*/*.sqlite; do sqlite3 $file 'VACUUM;';done What this does ie optimize every sqlite database in your account’s profiles. You can even add this line to a script to start on boot or by cron. Worth noting that Firefox should probably not run while you do this.

item.title: Got a packet bigger than ‘max_allowed_packet’ bytes
item.description: I got this on a newly installed server when I tried to import a database: [root@host ~]# mysql -u user -pPassword database < database.sql Enter password: ERROR 1153 (08S01) at line 53: Got a packet bigger than 'max_allowed_packet' bytes It’s easily fixable. The default is probably 16M, I added the following in /etc/my.cnf max_allowed_packet=32M And restarted mysql (depending on your distro you will do this differently): service mysqld restart

item.title: MariaDB vs MySQL short benchmark
item.description: Considering switching from MySQL to MariaDB? Me too. I wanted to see if I can look towards any performance improvements (or drops). I don’t have high level needs, I’m sure more comprehensive tests exist. This is simple run-all-tests.pl from sql-bench suite. The test machine was a CentOS VM with 2Gb RAM and 2 CPU cores assigned.
